p: Parental history of vaccine refusal was unsurprisingly associated with lower UTD status of all vaccines studied (the 4:3:1:3:3:1:4 and complete influenza vaccine status). What is particularly interesting, however, is that a unique determinant of hidden vulnerability to influenza was parental history of never delaying vaccination. While vaccine hesitancy has risen recently, [ 65] child influenza vaccination rates have been lower than other vaccines for quite some time and our finding was independent of general vaccine hesitancy. This finding likely represents longstanding hesitancy specific to the influenza vaccine.
